FDG.function_description: Product search, brand info, and activity tracking

core_logic.logic: The flow starts with inputting 'organic pasta' in the search bar. Then, one can either click the 'Read Now' button for the Racconto brand or click the 'Recent Searches' tab, with these being two separate branches from the initial input step.

steps.summary: Input 'organic pasta' in the search bar
Click 'Read Now' button for Racconto brand
Click 'Recent Searches' tab

FDG.function_description: The current page functions as a camera - based scanning interface, enabling users to scan items (presumably for pantry - related purposes) by using the device's camera to capture the relevant objects within the designated scanning frame.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 0, where the user clicks the 'Scan product' floating action button to navigate to the scanning page (page 1). On the scanning page, the user can repeatedly click the 'Trigger barcode scan' button (looping on the same page) to initiate barcode scans for pantry - related items, with each click attempting to scan an item within the scanning frame.

steps.summary: Click 'Scan product' button to enter scanning page
Click 'Trigger barcode scan' button to scan item

FDG.function_description: Home tab (bottom navigation)

core_logic.logic: The core execution logic for the Home tab functional point involves a single step: clicking the Home tab in the bottom navigation. This action navigates from the initial page (page 0) to the destination page (page 2), with no branching or looping logic as it is a straightforward navigation action.

steps.summary: Click the Home tab in bottom navigation

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to view and manage their shopping lists, with the option to create a new shopping list when no lists currently exist.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 0 and clicks the Activity tab in bottom navigation to navigate to page 3 (Shopping Lists page). On page 3, if there are no lists (UI shows 'No Lists Yet'), the user can click the top right '+' button to create a new shopping list.

steps.summary: Click Activity tab in bottom navigation to go to Shopping Lists page
Click top right '+' button to create new shopping list

FDG.function_description: The "My Pantry" page allows users to search for stored items, categorize them (e.g., All Items, Frozen, Fridge, Produce), add new items, and view the results of their search within a selected category (currently showing no items for "canned tomatoes").

core_logic.logic: The user starts by clicking the Products tab in bottom navigation to reach the My Pantry page. Then, they input 'canned tomatoes' into the search bar. Finally, they click the Produce category button to view search results (which show no items) within that category.

steps.summary: Navigate to My Pantry via Products tab
Search for 'canned tomatoes' in pantry
View results in Produce category

FDG.function_description: The current page (Profile tab) functions as a user dashboard to view and track personal activity metrics (e.g., scans, quizzes, spotlights), progress on tasks, and access profile editing or settings, with navigation to stats and badges sections.

core_logic.logic: The flow starts on page 0, where the user clicks the Profile tab in the bottom navigation (action [0,7]) to navigate to page 5 (the Profile dashboard). From page 5, the user can click the back arrow button (action [5,0]) to return to page 0. This creates a simple navigation loop between the initial page and the Profile dashboard.

steps.summary: Click Profile tab in bottom navigation to go to Profile dashboard
Click back arrow button to return to previous page (page 0)

FDG.function_description: Close scan barcode window

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the scan barcode (Scan for Pantry) page. The core logic is to click the close button (X icon) at the top-left of the scan window, which navigates to the destination page (page 6), completing the action of closing the scan barcode window.

steps.summary: Click the close (X) button to close the scan barcode window

FDG.function_description: The current page displays a "Pantry Limit Reached" message, informing the user they've hit the 20 - item limit for free users and offering an option to upgrade to Premium for unlimited pantry storage, along with a "Not Now" option.

core_logic.logic: The user encounters the 'Pantry Limit Reached' message. At this point, the user can choose to either click 'Upgrade to Premium' to proceed with upgrading for unlimited storage or click 'Not Now' to dismiss the message. These are mutually exclusive options, so the flow branches based on the user's choice.

steps.summary: Click the 'Create List' button (though this action leads to the pantry limit dialog context)
Choose between 'Upgrade to Premium' or 'Not Now' in the pantry limit dialog

FDG.function_description: The page functions as a pantry management interface where users can search for pantry items (e.g., "canned tomatoes"), view categorized pantry items (with categories like All Items, Frozen, Fridge, Produce), and add new items (via the + button) or scan items (via the scan icon), with feedback provided when no items match the search term.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the My Pantry page. They click the 'All Items' category button, which likely updates the displayed pantry items to show all items (though in this case, no items are present).

steps.summary: Click the 'All Items' category button

FDG.function_description: The page allows users to search for pantry items (e.g., "canned tomatoes") and view categorized (All Items, Frozen, Fridge, Produce) pantry inventory, with options to add items or scan products.

core_logic.logic: The user starts on the My Pantry page. They can click the Frozen category button (or other category buttons like All Items, Fridge, Produce) to view pantry inventory filtered by that category. The flow focuses on selecting the Frozen category to see its associated items, with the page remaining on the My Pantry view after the click.

steps.summary: Click the Frozen category button to view pantry items in the Frozen category

FDG.function_description: The "My Pantry" page allows users to search for pantry items (e.g., "canned tomatoes"), organize items by categories (All Items, Frozen, Fridge, Produce), add new items, and scan products, with the current search showing no results for the entered term.

FDG.function_description: The page functions as a scanner interface for adding or managing pantry items by capturing product barcodes or images using the device's camera.

FDG.function_description: The "My Pantry" page allows users to search for pantry items (e.g., "canned tomatoes"), organize items by categories (All Items, Frozen, Fridge, Produce), add new items, and scan products, with the current search showing no results for the entered term.

FDG.function_description: The current page (a modal) allows users to select a method to add items to their pantry, with options including searching products, scanning barcodes, scanning receipts (premium), and syncing the pantry (premium).

core_logic.logic: The flow starts with clicking the 'Add item button' (from page 4) to open the 'Add Items to Pantry' modal. This modal presents four options: Search Products, Scan Barcode, Receipt Scan (premium), and Sync Pantry (premium). The user then selects one of these options to proceed with adding items to the pantry.

steps.summary: Click the 'Add item button' to open the 'Add Items to Pantry' modal with options to add items.

FDG.function_description: The Settings page allows users to edit their first name, last name, and username (with a 30 - day change restriction for username) and save the changes made to their account information.
data_in: user profile (first name, last name, username)

core_logic.logic: The user starts on page 5 and clicks the Settings gear icon to navigate to the Settings page (page 13). On the Settings page, the user inputs a new first name (John) into the First Name field, then inputs a new last name (Doe) into the Last Name field. Finally, the user clicks the Save Changes button to save the updated account information.

steps.summary: Click Settings gear icon to open Settings page
Input 'John' into First Name field
Input 'Doe' into Last Name field
Click Save Changes button to save edits

FDG.function_description: The page functions as a modal dialog for managing the user's profile photo, providing options to cancel the action, remove the current photo, or choose a new photo from the device's library.

Once the modal is open, the user can choose to cancel the action, remove the current photo, or choose a new photo from the library, with the cancel and choose from library actions being directly executable steps.

Click Choose from library button

The user is then presented with two options: upgrade to Premium or select 'Not Now'. The flow branches at the popup step, where clicking 'Upgrade to Premium' (action in S1) leads to the Premium upgrade flow, and clicking 'Not Now' (implied but not in the single action provided here) would dismiss the popup.
